synopsis.text:
Disaster and hope intertwine in this heartwarming anime project, "Zapuni," where renowned musicians and Japanese visual artists unite to create music videos dedicated to the children affected by the Great Tohoku Earthquake and Fukushima Nuclear Disaster. The project's primary goal is to raise funds for various charities supporting these children, showcasing the healing power of music and art.

In one of the videos, a resilient old farmer, watched over by celestial beings, strives to revive his tsunami-ravaged land, commemorating the devastating earthquake and tsunami that struck Tohoku on March 3rd, 2011.

Another poignant piece, "Blossom," is a touching tribute to the memory of the 3/11 Tohoku disaster. This short animated work, set to music, serves as a reminder to never forget those who were directly affected by the catastrophe. Through these creative endeavors, the anime project aims to bring solace and hope to the victims and their families while raising awareness about the ongoing recovery efforts.
